name: Logic Programming
description: A programming paradigm based formal logic, representing knowledge as a set of facts and rules that define relationships among entities.

name: Rules-Based Systems
description: Systems that use "if-then" rules to derive decisions and actions from given facts and conditions.

name: Semantic Networks
description: Graph-based structures used to represents knowledge as a network of relationships, with knowledge as nodes and concepts as edges, representing relationships.

name: Knowledge Representation
description: A set of techniques used to formalize and structure knowledge in way that can be used by machines for reasoning.

name: Markov Models
description: Probabilistic models that assume the future state depends only on the current state, commonly used for sequential data analysis.

name: Statistical Inference
description: The processes and techniques used to draw conclusions about population or process parameters based on sample data and probabilistic reasoning.

name: Probability Theory
description: The broad foundational mathematical framework tools used in many fields to model uncertainty and randomness, and analyze data distributions.

name: Bayesian Network
description: Graphical models that represent probabilistic relationships among variables, enabling inference under uncertainty.

name: Evolutionary Algorithms
description: A set of techniques inspired by natural selection, where solutions evolved over generations through operations like mutation, crossover & selection.

name: Supervised Learning
description: A machine learning approach that uses labeled data to train models to make predictions on unlabeled data.

name: Unsupervised Learning
description: A machine learning approach that finds underlying patterns and groupings in data without labels.

name: Reinforcement Learning
description: A learning paradigm where an agent learns optimal actions by interacting with an environment and receiving feedback in the form of rewards or penalties to guide its actions.

name: Supervised Learning
description: A machine learning approach that uses labeled data to train models to make predictions on unlabeled data.

name: Unsupervised Learning
description: A machine learning approach that finds underlying patterns and groupings in data without labels.

name: Artificial Neural Networks
description: Machine learning models loosely inspired by the human brain, built using layers of interconnected nodes.

name: Deep Learning
description: Neural networks with multiple layers, typically with non-linear activation functions, to learn representations of the data at multiple levels of abstraction.

name: Convolutional Neural Networks
description: A type of deep neural network architecture designed for analyzing visual data using convolutional layers.

name: Recurrent Neural Networks
description: Neural networks designed for sequential data via feedback loops, where the outputs depend on current and previous inputs.

name: Generative Adversarial Networks
description: A method that uses two competing neural networks , a generator and a discriminator or evaluator, iteratively refining generated data to match real data distributions, producing realistic synthetic data.

name: Variational Autoencoders
description: Generative neural networks that learn probabilistic latent representations of input data, enabling generation by sampling and decoding from the latent space.

name: Transformer
description: A deep learning architecture that used an attention mechanism for parallelized processing of sequential data.

name: Forward Chaining
description: Data-driven approaches to reasoning that start from known facts and apply inference rules to derive new facts and conclusions until a goal is reached.

name: Backward Chaining
description: Approaches to reasoning that start with a desired goal and work backwards through logical rules to determine which facts must be true to support it.

name: A* Search
description: An optimization algorithm that finds the best route to a goal by balancing the cost so far using heuristics to guide the search and make decisions efficiently.

name: Depth-First/Best-First Search
description: Approaches for exploring decision spaces systematically traversing or searching through tree or graph data structures, each employing a distinct strategy to explore nodes.

name: Resolution Theorem Proving
description: Procedures that apply logical inference rules to systematically derive conclusions from a set of premises by resolving contradictions in logic.

name: Constraint Satisfaction Problems
description: The process of finding solutions that meet all specified constraints within a given problem space.

name: MiniMax Algorithm
description: A strategy for decision-making for adversarial games by that helps pick the best move by minimizing loss and maximizing gain.

name: Dynamic Programming
description: A technique that solves complex problems by breaking them into simpler parts, and using solutions in a recursive way to reduce computations and time.

name: Semantic Network Traversal
description: Approaches that navigate relationships within a semantic network to help understand interconnections and infer new knowledge or answer queries.

name: Knowledge Graph Methods
description: Methods that organize and connect information to help systems navigate, query and update facts to derive information from the connected nodes.

name: K-Means Clustering
description: An unsupervised machine learning method groups data points into a chosen number of clusters by finding the best “centers” for each group.

name: Genetic Programming
description: A technique that uses “survival of the fittest” to automatically evolve computer programs to solve problems.

name: Hierarchical Clustering
description: An unsupervised machine learning method for clustering data by that builds nested groups by merging or splitting data.

name: Markov Chain
description: An approach to modeling a dynamic system where the probability of next state depends solely on the current state.

name: Belief Propagation
description: An iterative message-passing algorithm used to perform inference on graphical models by passing messages, where messages encode a local “’beliefs” about the neighbouring variables, enabling efficient computation of marginal distributions (approximate margninals in the case of “loopy graphs”).

name: Hypothesis Testing
description: A statistical method for assessing assumptions about a population using sample data.

name: Expectation Maximization
description: An iterative algorithm for finding maximum likelihood estimates in models with latent variables.

name: Policy Gradient Methods
description: Reinforcement learning algorithms that update the parameters of policy by estimating the gradients towards maximizing cumulative rewards.

name: Q-Learning
description: A reinforcement learning algorithm that learns the value of actions in states to maximize long-term reward.

name: Proximal Policy Optimization
description: A reinforcement learning algorithm that improves policies by limiting changes using clipped object functions.

name: Logistic Regression
description: A statistical machine learning method used for binary classification that predicts the probability of class membership using a logistic function.

name: Principal Component Analysis
description: A dimensionality reduction technique that projects data onto orthogonal directions that capture the most variance.

name: Support Vector Machine
description: A supervised learning algorithm that finds the optimal hyperplane to separate classes in a high-dimensional space.

name: Random Forest
description: An ensemble learning method that builds multiple decision trees using different subsets of data and features, and combines their outputs, improving generalizability and robustness.

name: Linear Regression
description: A statistical method that models the linear relationship between input features and a continuous target variable.

name: Backpropagation
description: An algorithm used to train neural networks by propagating error gradients from output back through the network.

name: Stochastic Gradient Descent
description: An optimization algorithm that updates model parameters using randomly selected mini-batches of data to approximate the true gradient.

name: Adam Optimizer
description: An adaptive learning-rate optimization algorithm combining RMSprop and momentum for efficient gradient-based training.

name: Attention Mechanism
description: A method to enable models to focus on relevant parts of the input by assigning importance scores to parts of the input.

name: Expert Systems
description: Programs that use rule-based reasoning to simulate human decision-making in specialized domains.

name: Semantic Web
description: An extension of the World Wide Web that enables machines to interpret and process data with semantic meaning.

name: Symbolic Mathematics
description: Techniques to manipulate mathematical expressions symbolically rather than numerically, enabling exact computation.

name: Ontologies
description: Structured representations of knowledge that define the concepts, relationships and constraints for a given domain.

name: Knowledge Graph Methods
description: Approaches to organizing and analyzing structure data through graphs of entities and their relationships, enabling reasoning and inference.

name: Automated Theorem Provers
description: Programs that use formal logic to automatically prove or discover mathematical and logical theorems.

name: Automated Reasoning Systems
description: Systems designed to infer new knowledge and make logical deductions based on known facts and rules.

name: Game playing
description: Systems designed to play and optimize strategies in games using decision-making algorithms.

name: Risk Assessment
description: Models that predict probabilities of adverse outcomes using statistical and machine learning techniques.

name: Drug Effectiveness
description: The evaluation of the therapeutic potential of pharmaceutical compounds and the probability of adverse reactions using statistical and AI methods.

name: Survival Analysis
description: The use of use of statistical models that predict time-to-event outcomes, such as failures, disease, death etc., using censored data.

name: Robotics
description: Systems, typically with mechanical components, that use AI to execute tasks autonomously through perception, planning and control.

name: Image Compression
description: The use of statistical and machine learning algorithms to reduce the file size of an image with minimizing degradation and preserving key visual features.

name: Speech Recognition
description: The machine learning task of converting spoken language into text using linguistic and acoustic modeling.

name: Image Classification
description: The supervised machine learning task of assigning labels to images based on visual content.

name: Text Classification
description: The supervised machine learning task of classifying text into predefined classes using natural language processing techniques.

name: Anomaly Detection
description: The machine learning task of identifying rare or unexpected patterns in data.

name: Remaining Useful Life
description: The statistical or machine learning task of predicting the time until a system or component fails.

name: Object Detection
description: The machine learning task of detecting and classifying multiple objects in an image or video.

name: Audio Classification
description: The machine learning task of categorizing audio clips into predefined classes.

name: Churn Prediction
description: The machine learning task of forecasting the likelihood of customers canceling or discontinuing a service subscription.

name: Text-to-Speech
description: The machine learning task of synthesizing human sounding speech from written text.

name: Text Summarization
description: The machine learning task of reducing documents into coherent summaries while retaining key information.

name: Text-to-Video
description: The machine learning task of generating video based on textual descriptions.

name: Text Generation
description: The machine learning task of generating human-like text from prompts in natural language.

name: Text-to-Image
description: The machine learning task of generating images from textual descriptions.

name: Image-to-Text
description: The machine learning task of generating descriptive or contextual text from images.

name: Video-to-Text
description: The machine learning task of generating textual descriptions or transcripts from video content.
